title: Reibelt Named Referee for 2023 - 24 A - League Women Final
body_text:
Football Australia is pleased to announce that Casey Reibelt will officiate this Saturday's 2023-24 Liberty A-League Women's Grand Final between Melbourne City FC and Sydney FC at AAMI Park in Melbourne.
Saturday's Grand Final will be Reibelt's third appointment as the referee for a W-League/ALW Grand Final, having also whistled the 2013 decider between Melbourne Victory FC and Brisbane Roar FC at Lakeside Stadium, and last year's match between Western United FC and Sydney FC at CommBank Stadium in Sydney.
Reibelt has also been a grand final additional assistant referee (AAR) in both 2019 and 2022, as well as fourth official on four occasions (2009, 2012, 2013, 2015).
In further exciting news for Reibelt, the Football Queensland product has been acknowledged for her outstanding season, being named the 2023-24 Liberty A-League Women Referee of the Year.
Supporting Reibelt will be Assistant Referees Emma Kocbek (Football NSW) and Maggie Price (Football NSW), along with Fourth Official Georgia Ghirardello (Capital Football) and Fifth Official Paula Orlandi (Football South Australia). Renae Coghill (Football Queensland) has also been appointed as Referee Coach for the match, herself a three-time grand final assistant referee (2015, 2016, 2019).
Kocbek (Football NSW) and Price (Football NSW) will feature in their first Liberty A-League Grand Final, however, they have both been involved in previous deciders, with Price appointed as Fourth Official in 2022, and Kocbek as Fifth Official last year.
Football Australia Head of Referees Nathan Magill said all the officials are deserving of their appointments following strong domestic seasons.
"The selection of Saturday's Liberty A-League Women's Grand Final officiating team is acknowledgment of their consistent performances throughout this season, particularly for Casey, who has had an exceptional twelve months both domestically and internationally, including being the first Australian woman to referee an AFC Champions League fixture.
"Casey represented Australia during the 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup, refereeing two matches, and has upheld the lofty standards of officiating both in the domestic leagues plus on the international stage ever since. It is only appropriate that Casey has been named the Liberty A-League Women Referee of the Year in recognition of her outstanding efforts this season.
"Football Australia along with the Referees Committee would like to extend our thanks and gratitude to the entire match officials panel for their commitment and professionalism throughout the 2023-24 season and wish those appointed for Saturday's grand final all the best of luck for the match," Magill concluded.
